title: Calories in Baba Ganoush
meta_description: Discover calories in baba ganoush per 100g serving, including fat, carbs, protein, and nutrition tweaks for this eggplant dip.
assumptions: Traditional recipe with roasted eggplant, tahini, olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, and salt; no added breads or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, oil amount, and ingredients; homemade versions differ from store-bought. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of baba ganoush has about 150 kcal, mainly from healthy fats in olive oil and tahini.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Low-oil version (reduce olive oil by half)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of baba ganoush?
Is baba ganoush high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 14g fat per 100g, mostly from olive oil and tahiniâ€”healthy unsaturated fats.

faqs.q: What's the protein in baba ganoush?
faqs.a: Around 2g protein per 100g, mainly from tahini and eggplant.

faqs.q: Does baba ganoush have carbs or fiber?
faqs.a: 7g carbs and 3g fiber per 100g, from eggplant and veggies.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in baba ganoush?
faqs.a: Reduce olive oil or tahini; opt for baked eggplant without added fats.
